description.en:
- features of academic texts;
- developing good writing habits; SWOT analysis of individual MA project/thesis plans
- looking for and assessing relevant sources; opportunities provided by UT library
- stages in research and academic writing as a process (outline, draft(s), working with feedback and revising, final version)
- working with others' texts: reading, paraphrasing, quoting
- formatting of academic texts
- oral presentations: theory and practice
description.et:
- mis teeb tekstist akadeemilise?
- minu head ja halvad töötamise harjumused; SWOT analüüs individuaalsest magistritöö või -projekti plaanist lähtuvalt
- teemakohaste allikate otsimine ja hindamine, TÜ raamatukogu võimalused
- uurimistöö etapid ja akadeemilne kirjutamine kui protsess (kavand, mustand(id), tagasisidega töötamine, lõplik versioon)
- töötamine teiste autorite tekstidega: lugemine, parafraseerimine ja tsiteerimine 
- akadeemilise teksti vormistamine
- suuline ettekanne: teooria ja praktika

objectives.en: The aim of this course is to practice the reading, creation and formatting of academic texts and to compose and deliver oral presentations with the further goal of developing students' ability to analyse and assess their study-related needs and strengths and to plan research according to their individual Master's thesis or project topic.
objectives.et: Kuruse eesmärgiks on harjutada akadeemiliste tekstide lugemist, loomist ja vormistamist ning suuliste ettekannete koostamist ja pidamist ning arendada õppijate eneseanalüüsi- ja hindamise ning uurimistöö planeerimise oskusi, lähtudes individuaalsetest magistrtöö või -projekti teemadest.

learning_outcomes.en: Upon completion of the course, students should
- be knowledgeable about the characteristics of academic texts;
- be able to search for academic sources and read them for the purpose of assessing their relevance to their own research;
learning_outcomes.et: - oskavad erialaseid akadeemilisi tekste otsida ja lugeda ning hinnata nende vajalikkust enda uurimistöös;

learning_outcomes.en: - be familiar with stages in research (incl. academic writing) and capable of planning their time and activities accordingly;
learning_outcomes.et: - tunnevad uurimistöö (sh akadeemilise teksti kirjutamise) etappe ja oskavad oma aega ja tegevusi vastavalt planeerida;

learning_outcomes.en: - create and format oral and written academic texts by applying knowledge and skills acquired during the course;
learning_outcomes.et: - oskavad suulist ja kirjalikku akadeemilist teksti luua ja korrektselt vormistada, rakendades selleks kursusel omandatud teadmisi ja oskusi;

learning_outcomes.en: - reflect on their writing habits and needs and assess needs for development;
learning_outcomes.et: - on teadlikud oma kirjutamisharjumustest ja -vajadustest ning suudavad hinnata arendamist vajavatest külgedest;

learning_outcomes.en: - analyse strengths and weaknesses in their MA thesis/project plans and organise their studies and research accordingly.
learning_outcomes.et: - suudavad analüüsida oma tugevusi ja nõrkusi uurimistöö tegemisel ning oma õpinguid ja uurimistööd neist lähtuvalt kavandada.

independent_work.et:
- Workshop on library resources: Use library resources to find at least 10 sources relevant for your thesis topic and made a properly formatted bibliography using a citation tool like Zotero, Mendeley, or EasyBib.

- Note taking and prewriting: 1. Either write a short description (1-2 paragraphs) of your note-taking system or a plan to create one. Describe any technologies you use in this system, whether they are analog (pen and paper) or digital (apps).
2. Turn in your notes for one of your readings or a class lecture (can be from a different class) including appropriate references and your own questions or reflections on the content.

08.03 MA thesis/project requirements: SWOT analysis of potential thesis project

- Ethnographic writing: Representation and argumentation: Choose an article or short reading for one of your other folklore classes and analyze the techniques the authors use to identify their own viewpoint and describe others. How do they distinguish between their own claims and other people's claims that they cite or represent in their writing? Write 1-2 pages reflecting on these techniques, any critiques you may have, and ways that you could apply what you learned in your own writing.

- Goal setting and productivity: Essay draft outline

- Conferences and Presentations: Responding to a CFP: For this assignment, you will get a mock CFP for the "student symposium" where we will give our final presentations. Using the CFP guidelines, submit an application for your presentation. 

- Finishing a draft: Essay draft + **Bring any questions you have about your draft!**

- Short oral presentation

Detailed guidelines in Moodle.
